data.chText: 颤抖，哆嗦（因寒冷、恐惧、激动等）
data.enText: to shake slightly because you are cold, frightened, excited, etc.

data.chText: 冷得发抖、激动得发抖、高兴得发抖等
别站在外面冻得打哆嗦了——进来暖暖身子吧！
data.enText: Don't stand outside shivering─come inside and get warm!

data.chText: 那寒冷黑暗的大海，他想想都吓得发抖。
data.enText: He shivered at the thought of the cold, dark sea.

data.chText: 颤抖，哆嗦（因寒冷、恐惧、激动等）
data.enText: a sudden shaking movement of your body because you are cold, frightened, excited, etc.

data.chText: 一听见他的说话声，她就背上一阵阵发冷。
data.enText: The sound of his voice sent shivers down her spine .
He felt a cold shiver of fear run through him.

data.chText: 寒战，寒噤（因恐惧或发高烧）
data.enText: shaking movements of your body because of fear or a high temperature

data.chText: 我不喜欢他，一见他我就不寒而栗。
data.enText: I don't like him. He gives me the shivers .

data.chText: 症状包括头痛、呕吐和打寒噤。
data.enText: Symptoms include headaches, vomiting and the shivers.

means: 哆嗦(因寒冷、恐惧、激动等)
颤抖(因寒冷、恐惧、激动等)

ex.enText: His hands were shaking with cold.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指人因激动、恐惧、寒冷等而全身或身体局部颤动，也指以任何形式颤动，含突然或不规则之意。

ex.chText: 他的名字太恐怖了，连坟墓中的死人听后都会发抖。
ex.enText: His name was so terrifying that the dead would be made quake in their graves.

ex.chText: 大地在我们的脚下颤动。
ex.enText: The ground quaked under our feet.

ex.chText: 爆炸使整幢大楼都晃动起来。
ex.enText: The explosion made the whole building quake.

synonyms.bx: 通常指人因恐惧而哆嗦，也指大地、建筑物等剧烈颤动。

ex.enText: The leaves were quivering in the breeze.

ex.chText: 她的双唇颤动着，竭力不哭出来。
ex.enText: Her lips quivered as she tried not to cry.

synonyms.bx: 指树叶、鸟的翅膀等抖动，也指人因恐惧、紧张等而嘴唇、声音等颤动，侧重于轻微、急速、连续不断，有时令人难以察觉，在程度上弱于 tremble。

ex.enText: She shivered when she saw the snake.

synonyms.bx: 指因寒冷、害怕等而轻微和快速地颤抖。

ex.chText: 房间里现在暖和了，但他仍在哆嗦。
ex.enText: The room is warm now, but he is still trembling.

ex.chText: 当火车从桥上开过时，桥身随之颤动起来。
ex.enText: The bridge trembled as the train went over it.

synonyms.bx: 指人因盛怒、寒冷、恐惧、虚弱等而轻微地抖动、战栗，常含无法克制之意，有时也指物体轻微地颤动。

ex.en: something sends a shiver down your spine

tr: a reflex motion caused by cold or fear or excitement
an almost pleasurable sensation of fright
example: a frisson of surprise shot through him
The children are shivering--turn on the heat!

tr: tremble convulsively, as from fear or excitement

value.def: When you shiver, your body shakes slightly because you are cold or frightened.

example.ex: I was sitting on the floor shivering with fear.
example.tran: 我坐在地板上，吓得发抖。

example.ex: The emptiness here sent shivers down my spine...
example.tran: 这里的空寂让我脊梁骨发凉。

example.ex: Alice gave a shiver of delight.

value.tran: (因寒冷或惧怕而)哆嗦，颤抖，发抖

tit: something sends a shiver down your spine
